column2: ’ Fermour said. ‘You wouldn’t. Though the signs were all round you
column4: because you have no standards of comparison. For instance
column5: you accepted the fact that one sleep-wake in four was dark. Living at four times the normal rate
column6: naturally four of your days or sleep-wakes only made one ordinary one. When the ship was a going concern – on the voyage out to Procyon – the lights automatically dimmed all over the vessel from midnight to six
column7: partly to give a friendly illusion of night
column8: partly to allow the servicers to work behind scenes
column9: making any necessary repairs. That brief six-hour shift is a whole day to you.’"|Non-Stop|"Brian W. Aldiss"
